**Potions** are useful consumable items represented by the '**!**' character. Every potion has a specific effect (beneficial or harmful) when [quaffed](/Quaff "Quaff").

You can't drink potions while [berserk](/Berserk "Berserk"), in [Death Form](/Death_Form "Death Form"), if you're a [Mummy](/Mummy "Mummy"), or during -Potion (after being damaged with the [No Unsafe Potions](/No_Unsafe_Potions "No Unsafe Potions") mutation). Monsters cannot drink potions.

### Rarity

Rarity per individual potion, rounded to the nearest tenth.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- Very Common: 18.4%
- Common: 10.0%
- Uncommon: 6.4%
- Rare: 3.3%
- Very Rare: 0.2%

## Potion Identification

Apart from using a [scroll of identify](/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify"), there are several ways to determine the identity of potions you've picked up.

You may guess at a potion's identity by the size of the stacks in your inventory. Potions of curing and potions of heal wounds are the two most common types of potions. Therefore, if you get multiple of the same potion, it is more likely to be one of these two. Note that potions can come in batches of 2 or 3, which are treated as one item for purposes of rarity. This is, of course, nonconclusive - but may be useful to know in a dire situation.

Quaffing a random potion is the most obvious way to figure out its contents, but may be dangerous. You'll want to be somewhere safe with no monsters in sight, in case of a [potion of ambrosia](/Potion_of_ambrosia "Potion of ambrosia"), [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification"), or [potion of berserk rage](/Potion_of_berserk_rage "Potion of berserk rage"). [Potions of degeneration](/Potions_of_degeneration "Potions of degeneration") and [potions of mutation](/Potions_of_mutation "Potions of mutation") are also harmful, with effects that do not wear off by simply passing turns.

Some more notes on potion identification:

- Many [backgrounds](/Background "Background") begin play with an identified potion.
- Certain [vaults](/Vault "Vault") may contain pre-identified items.
- The [Sewer](/Sewer "Sewer") will often contain some [potions of flight](/Potions_of_flight "Potions of flight").

## See Also

- [Scroll](/Scroll "Scroll")

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), monsters could drink potions.
- In [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), potion rarities were changed to be more consistent.
- Prior to [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), some potions could not be found in a stack of 2-3 identical potions. This could be used to narrow down potion types.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), Thirsty [Vampires](/Vampires "Vampires") did not receive full effects from potions.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), potions provided 40 [satiation](/Satiation "Satiation"). You could drink otherwise useless potions to satiate hunger.
- Prior to [0.12](/0.12 "0.12"), the [Evaporate](/Evaporate "Evaporate") spell could consume potions to generate [clouds](/Cloud "Cloud"). You could also identify several unpleasant potions by creating samples of them through [Fulsome Distillation](/Fulsome_Distillation "Fulsome Distillation").

### Obsolete Potions

- [Potion of flight](/Potion_of_flight "Potion of flight") - [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), renamed to [potion of enlightenment](/Potion_of_enlightenment "Potion of enlightenment")
- [Potion of stabbing](/Potion_of_stabbing "Potion of stabbing") - [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), replaced by [potion of attraction](/Potion_of_attraction "Potion of attraction").
- [Potion of agility](/Potion_of_agility "Potion of agility") - [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), replaced by potion of stabbing.
- [Potion of blood](/Potion_of_blood "Potion of blood") - [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), with removal of [Vampire](/Vampire "Vampire") hunger.
- [Potion of beneficial mutation](/Potion_of_beneficial_mutation "Potion of beneficial mutation") and [potion of cure mutation](/Potion_of_cure_mutation "Potion of cure mutation") - [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), merged with [potion of mutation](/Potion_of_mutation "Potion of mutation").
- [Potion of poison](/Potion_of_poison "Potion of poison") - [0.18](/0.18 "0.18").
- [Potion of decay](/Potion_of_decay "Potion of decay") - [0.17](/0.17 "0.17").
- [Potion of restore abilities](/Potion_of_restore_abilities "Potion of restore abilities"), [potion of coagulated blood](/Potion_of_coagulated_blood "Potion of coagulated blood"), and [potion of porridge](/Potion_of_porridge "Potion of porridge") - [0.16](/0.16 "0.16").
- [Potion of strong poison](/Potion_of_strong_poison "Potion of strong poison") - [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").
- [Potion of paralysis](/Potion_of_paralysis "Potion of paralysis") - [0.15](/0.15 "0.15").
- [Potion of slowing](/Potion_of_slowing "Potion of slowing") - [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), replaced with [potion of lignification](/Potion_of_lignification "Potion of lignification").
- [Potion of gain strength](/Potion_of_gain_strength "Potion of gain strength"), [potion of gain intelligence](/Potion_of_gain_intelligence "Potion of gain intelligence"), and [potion of gain dexterity](/Potion_of_gain_dexterity "Potion of gain dexterity") - [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), replaced by potion of beneficial mutation.
- [Potion of water](/Potion_of_water "Potion of water") and [potion of levitation](/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation") - [0.12](/0.12 "0.12").

An unlabeled flask containing a single dose of unknown liquid.

"Then gave I her, - so tutor'd by my art, -
A sleeping potion, which so took effect
As I intended, for it wrought on her
The form of death: meantime I writ to Romeo
That he should hither come as this dire night,
To help to take her from her borrow'd grave,
Being the time the potion's force should cease."

-William Shakespeare, _Romeo and Juliet_

List of potions

Tile Potion of ... Rarity[1] Description
ambrosia Rare Confuses you, but dramatically increases your health and magic regeneration for several turns.
attraction Uncommon Pulls all monsters in line of sight towards you for several turns.
berserk rage Rare Makes you go berserk for several turns, increasing your speed and melee damage but inducing a period of slowness when it wears off.
brilliance Uncommon Grants Brilliance, increasing spell power and decreasing MP costs for several turns.
cancellation Rare Ends many status effects (both good and bad) and reduces magic contamination.
curing Very Common Removes poison and confusion; also heals 5-11 HP.
degeneration Uncommon Temporarily reduces all attributes (Str, Int, and Dex) by 1-3 points.
enlightenment Uncommon Increases willpower and lets you fly for several dozen turns.
experience Very Rare You immediately gain a level and a large amount of XP to apply to your skills.
haste Uncommon Grants Haste for several turns, greatly speeding your actions.
heal wounds Common Heals 10-37 HP.
invisibility Rare Makes you invisible for several turns.
lignification Uncommon Grants you Tree form for several turns, increasing your defense but leaving you unable to move.
magic Rare Recovers 10-37 MP.
might Uncommon Grants the Might condition for several turns, increasing your melee damage.
mutation Uncommon Removes 2-3 mutations, then gives 1-3 random mutations, then a 50% for one good mutation.
resistance Rare Provides one level each of fire, cold, electricity, poison, and acid resistance for several turns.
